channel.title: Chat logs
channel.description:
Hey i want to add chatlogs on my server i've looked on the forums for tuts on it but for some reason they don't work..
im currently using deltascape source/xscape
Can somone please tell me the code please?
Thanks much apprciated

item.title: Chat logs
item.dc:creator: @wat72 wat72
item.description:
@wat72 wrote:

[quote=“Digital Hotdogs, post:9, topic:260672”][quote author=wat72 link=topic=344225.msg2656992#msg2656992 date=1233941783]
Why do you want chatlogs? It will just cause tones of lag.
[/quote]Not really.[/quote]Writing to text files every time someone talks is going to put a lot of stress on the server, ESPECIALLY if someone uses SYI and the server doesn’t have SYI protection.

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:12, topic:260672”][quote author=Digital Hotdogs link=topic=344225.msg2656994#msg2656994 date=1233941825]
Not really.
[/quote]
Oh yes it does (If you have a popular server), you have to remember that java has to constantly update that log and that uses up a lot of memory and cpu.

You don’t need to create a chatlog file as it automaticly creates one if it can’t find one to write the text to.

You really dont know about java. Maybe procedure has not been been coded yet![/quote]Sounds like you’re a C programmer. Java doesn’t have procedures, just methods and other object oriented things like that.

Read full topic

@Digital_Hotdogs wrote:

In case 4 above break; change chatLog(); to chatlog(); cause I’m pretty sure capitals do matter.

item.title: Chat logs
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Well, if it’s saying it cant find the method chatLog, you obviously didn’t add any of this:

    public void chatlog() {
        Calendar cal = new GregorianCalendar();
        int hour24 = cal.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY); // 0..23
        int min = cal.get(Calendar.MINUTE); // 0..59
        int sec = cal.get(Calendar.SECOND); // 0..59
        BufferedWriter bww = null;

        try {
            bww = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("notes/chatlogs.txt", true));
            bww.write(
	      "time: " + hour24 + "." + min + "." + sec + " | "
	      + playerName + ": "
	      + misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2));
            bww.newLine();
            bww.newLine();
            bww.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bww != null) {
	  try {
	      bww.close();
	  } catch (IOException ioe2) {}
            }
        }
    }

And as for what to call your chatlogs, just simply save i as chatlogs. Nothing special, just a txt file.

Read full topic

item.title: Chat logs
item.dc:creator: @Kalvin Kalvin
item.description:
@Kalvin wrote:

so what file do i call my chat logs?[quote=“The Reaper X, post:10, topic:260672”]Open up the “notes” folder i guess. Create a .txt file called “chatlogs”.

Open up your client.java and add this:

    public void chatlog() {
        Calendar cal = new GregorianCalendar();
        int hour24 = cal.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY); // 0..23
        int min = cal.get(Calendar.MINUTE); // 0..59
        int sec = cal.get(Calendar.SECOND); // 0..59
        BufferedWriter bww = null;

        try {
            bww = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("notes/chatlogs.txt", true));
            bww.write(
	      "time: " + hour24 + "." + min + "." + sec + " | "
	      + playerName + ": "
	      + misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2));
            bww.newLine();
            bww.newLine();
            bww.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bww != null) {
	  try {
	      bww.close();
	  } catch (IOException ioe2) {}
            }
        }
    }[/code]

After that search for "case 4:" or "regular chat". You should see something like this:

[code]
String playerchat = "["+playerName+"]: "+misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize-2)+"";
			if (!validClient) {
				sM("Please use another client");
				break;
			}
			if (muted)
				break;
			MBTC = misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2);
			MBBC = misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2);
			MBHT = misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2);
			MBID = misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2);
			chatTextEffects = inStream.readUnsignedByteS();
			chatTextColor = inStream.readUnsignedByteS();
			chatTextSize = (byte) (packetSize - 2);
			inStream.readBytes_reverseA(chatText, chatTextSize, 0);
			chatTextUpdateRequired = true;
			break;
[/code]

After "chatTextUpdateRequired" line, add this:
[code]
chatLog();
[/code]

That should start writing a chatlog for you.[/quote]

Done all of that and i get the error about the chatlog(); heres the error
[code]client.java:11902: cannot find symbol
symbol  : method chatLog()
location: class client
                        chatLog();
                        ^
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .

And heres my code

case 4:
			// regular chat
String playerchat = "["+playerName+"]: "+misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize-2)+"";
			if (!validClient) {
				sM("Please use another client");
				break;
			}
			if (muted)
				break;
			MBTC = misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2);
			MBBC = misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2);
			MBHT = misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2);
			MBID = misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2);
			chatTextEffects = inStream.readUnsignedByteS();
			chatTextColor = inStream.readUnsignedByteS();
			chatTextSize = (byte) (packetSize - 2);
			inStream.readBytes_reverseA(chatText, chatTextSize, 0);
			chatTextUpdateRequired = true;
                        chatLog();
			break;

Read full topic

item.title: Chat logs
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Open up the “notes” folder i guess. Create a .txt file called “chatlogs”.

Open up your client.java and add this:

[code]
public void chatlog() {
Calendar cal = new GregorianCalendar();
int hour24 = cal.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY); // 0…23
int min = cal.get(Calendar.MINUTE); // 0…59
int sec = cal.get(Calendar.SECOND); // 0…59
BufferedWriter bww = null;

    try {
        bww = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("notes/chatlogs.txt", true));
        bww.write(
      "time: " + hour24 + "." + min + "." + sec + " | "
      + playerName + ": "
      + misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2));
        bww.newLine();
        bww.newLine();
        bww.flush();
    } catch (IOException ioe) {
        ioe.printStackTrace();
    } finally {
        if (bww != null) {
  try {
      bww.close();
  } catch (IOException ioe2) {}
        }
    }
}[/code]

After that search for “case 4:” or “regular chat”. You should see something like this:

String playerchat = "["+playerName+"]: "+misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize-2)+"";
			if (!validClient) {
				sM("Please use another client");
				break;
			}
			if (muted)
				break;
			MBTC = misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2);
			MBBC = misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2);
			MBHT = misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2);
			MBID = misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2);
			chatTextEffects = inStream.readUnsignedByteS();
			chatTextColor = inStream.readUnsignedByteS();
			chatTextSize = (byte) (packetSize - 2);
			inStream.readBytes_reverseA(chatText, chatTextSize, 0);
			chatTextUpdateRequired = true;
			break;

After “chatTextUpdateRequired” line, add this:

chatLog();

That should start writing a chatlog for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Chat logs
item.dc:creator: @Kalvin Kalvin
item.description:
@Kalvin wrote:

nvm about that i got this code already in there called

[code] BufferedWriter bw = null;

	try {
		bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("config//" + file + ".txt",
				true));
		bw.write(data);
		bw.newLine();
		bw.flush();
	} catch (IOException ioe) {
		ioe.printStackTrace();
	} finally {
		if (bw != null)
			try {
				bw.close();
			} catch (IOException ioe2) {
				System.out.println("Error writing system log.");
				ioe2.printStackTrace();
			}
	}[/code]

But there isnt a file in the config called chatlogs :S

Read full topic
